content: on to the needle knit into it creating a left-leaning increase then knit the next stitch continue to increase every-other- round inside of gusset markers on the cc round until you have 16 gusset stitches inside of the two gusset markers continue with no increases inside of the gusset markers for 5 more rounds ending having just knit in in mc upper hand  6 on the next cc round knit around up to the first gusset marker remove marker and place all 16 of the thumb gusset stitches on to a piece of waste yarn or flexible holder then remove second gusset marker bridge 2 stitches across in cc cast on 2 stitches with backward loop with working yarn on the right needle thereby adding 2 stitches to bridge across hand totaling 44 stitches continue around to end proceed knitting upper hand alternating colors for 11 more rounds ending with a mc round switch to smaller needles and mc and work rib for 6 rounds or until desired width of rib bind off thumb  7 transfer stitches from the holder they will be in mc and pick up and mount two loops from edge of knitted bridge across the hand you can improvise this trying for main color but any picked up stitch loop will work creating 2 more stitches for a total of 18 thumb stitches with smaller needles in mc work rib for 6 rounds or desired width of rib bind off  finish  weave in loose ends give your mitts a nice gentle soak in warm water with liquid wool soap for about 20 minutes rinse press excess water out between dry towels and dry flat contact  you can find this pattern and other original designs by
